questions.question: 6. Factors that affect the strength and specificity of the proteinâ€“DNA interactions under study include

answers.a: The ionic strength and pH of the binding buffer
answers.b: Presence of glycerol or carrier proteins (e.g., BSA)
answers.c: The presence/absence of divalent cations (e.g., Mg<sup>2+</sup> or Zn<sup>2+</sup>)

questions.question: 7. Before a binding reaction is performed, gels are pre-run at a constant voltage (30-90 minutes) in a cold room or using other methods to keep the gel cool

answers.a: to remove all traces of ammonium persulfate
answers.b: to ensure a constant gel temperature
answers.c: to equilibrate any special stabilizing factors or ions that were added to the electrophoresis buffer

questions.question: 8. Method alternative to Electrophoretic Mobility Shift Assay (EMSA) for studying protein-DNA interactions
9. Why sometimes there are multiple bands in EMSA

answers.a: Because of the dissociation occurs during electrophoresis
answers.b: A single DNA molecule has multiple binding sites for an individual protein

answers.a: Studying the affinity of protein-DNA interactions
answers.b: Studying the specificity of protein-DNA interactions
